description: In Kyoto in the year 2027, Naomi Katagaki, a male high school student encounters a person who is claiming to be Naomi from 10 years in the future. Together, they must change the future and save a classmate, Ruri, whom the younger Naomi starts to date in three months.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

title.native: はろー（らぶこめ）わーるど
HELLO WORLD if ー勘解由小路三鈴は世界で最初の失恋をするー

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dochibibi) Yukiko Horiguchi is an animator, illustrator and character designer formerly belonging to Kyoto Animation. She joined Kyoto Animation in 2003 after graduating from a junior college (tanki daigaku). She started as inbetweener on Shin-Chan, before making a debut as key animator on the KyoAni in-house OVA Munto. In 2007 she was given the chance to design characters for the anime adaptation of the Lucky Star yon-koma manga. Horiguchi is particularly known for the shape she gives her drawings, resulting in a certain roundness and the distinctly fine outline and peculiar shading. Her characters appear to be very child-like and cute, and full of energy, which is a major appeal to the fans. The illustrator [BUNBUN](https://anilist.co/staff/112785) is her younger brother.

__Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube | Facebook__ Biography Okamoto's is a Japanese rock band, formed in 2006. They made their major label debut May 26, 2010 and were signed by record label Ariola Japan. Okamoto's was formed by four junior high school students. Fans of influential Japanese avant-garde artist Tarou Okamoto, the members took a cue from The Ramones and each adopted stage names with the surname Okamoto. Members __[Shou Okamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148602) (オカモトショウ)__ – vocals Real name Shou Iimura (飯村翔). Born October 19, 1990 in New York City. Former member of Zutto Zuletellz (ズットズレテルズ/Zuttozureteruzu) and the children's performance group Precoci. Son of American jazz saxophonist Scott Hamilton. __[Kouki Okamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148604) (オカモトコウキ)__ – guitar Real name Kouki Hayashi (林幸希i). Born November 5, 1990 in Nerima City, Tokyo, Japan. Reiji Okamoto (オカモトレイジ) – drums Real name Reiji Miyake (三宅零治). Born January 9, 1991 in Futako-Tamagawa, Setagaya, Tokyo. Former Zutto Zuletellz member. He is the eldest son of The Privates lead singer Tatsuji Nobuhara (延原達治). In his childhood he made child role dramas. Hama Okamoto (ハマ・オカモト) – bass Real name Ikumi Hamada (濵田郁未). Born March 12, 1991 in Tokyo. Former Zutto Zuletellz member. He is the eldest son of Masatoshi Hamada and Natsumi Ogawa. Former Members Masaru Okamoto (オカモトマサル) – bass (2006–2009) (Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](https://higedan.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialhige) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialhigedandism) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialhigedandism/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3vg17IZ1IV73xx069jG44w) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Vo1hnCRmCM6M4thZCInCj)

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [Satoshi Fujihara](https://anilist.co/staff/277082) (藤原聡) - born August 19, 1991 (lead vocals, piano)
• Daisuke Ozasa (小笹大輔) - born January 6, 1994 (lead guitar, backing vocals)
• Makoto Narazaki (楢﨑誠) - born March 18, 1989 (bass, saxophone, backing vocals)
• Masaki Matsuura (松浦匡希) - born January 22, 1993 (drums, percussion, backing vocals)

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satoshi_higedan) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/satoshi_higedan)

Lead singer-songwriter and keyboardist for Japanese rock band [Official HIGE DANdism](https://anilist.co/staff/143110).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satoshi_higedan) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/satoshi_higedan)

Kouichi Tsutaya is a Japanese musician affiliated with agehasprings, who does music production, composition and arrangement, while also being a lyricist, pianist and keyboardist.

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Takeshi Kobayashi is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist, keyboardist and record producer.

title.native: 打ち上げ花火、下から見るか？横から見るか？
あした世界が終わるとしても
失われた未来を求めて
色づく世界の明日から
可愛いだけじゃない式守さん
君を愛したひとりの僕へ
新世紀エヴァンゲリオン劇場版 Air/まごころを、君に
僕が愛したすべての君へ
夏へのトンネル、さよならの出口
アリスとテレスのまぼろし工場
